1149681902334423040.text: House Democrats stripped this provision from the #NDAA because they are soft on terror and they want to close Guantanamo Bay. Our national security will suffer because of their actions.

1149681901617262592.text: As the former Chief of Detainee Operations for Multi-National Division North in Operation Iraqi Freedom, I know the threat these terrorists pose to our communities and families, as well as our national security.

1149681900929392641.text: This means that terrorists who are currently being held at Guantanamo Bay can be transferred to a neighborhood near you.

1149681900094726145.text: This year, House Democrats chose to remove the provision from the #NDAA and also blocked an attempt by @RepRalphNorman to add the language to the bill through the amendment process.

1149681899453014016.text: Every #NDAA since FY 2010 included a provision to prohibit the use of funds to transfer detainees from Guantanamo Bay to the United States.

1149679806776250369.text: For decades the #NDAA has been a bipartisan bill—even this year in the Senate their version passed 86-8. But instead, House Democrats chose to play political games with our national security.

1149676417644294144.text: This year, House Democrats chose to put partisanship in front of our national interests, our national security, and our servicemembers in their #NDAA.

1104046617143980033.text: Under H.R. 1, taxpayer dollars will be going to support entrenched politicians and political consultants who we don’t agree with or want to support.

1104045358701699079.text: Our tax dollars should go to funding our military and protecting American citizens, not to promoting politicians we don’t even agree with. That’s why I’m voting no on H.R. 1.

1104044101069144064.text: H.R. 1 takes power away from voters and puts it in the hands of convicted criminals. The bill would strip voters of their 14th Amendment rights to limit the vote to people who haven’t been convicted of murder, violent felonies, or other serious crimes.

1104042842593378306.text: H.R. 1 is a slap in the face to our democratic system. This bill attacks the rights of the states and puts our election security at risk.

1104041585031958529.text: Under H.R. 1, there would be no checks and balances to prevent voter fraud and no penalties for ineligible individuals voting in error.

1104040325251624961.text: Same-day voter registration is a threat to our democratic process. When voters are allowed to register on the same day there is very little room to confirm identity and ensure they are voting in the correct election.

1104039066964643840.text: Every day, personal data is at risk online. With H.R. 1, the democrats would add to this threat by requiring states to maintain online voter registration with no safeguards.

1104037809604550656.text: H.R. 1 would require that all states adopt an automatic voter registration system that would rely on the federal government for records. This could lead to thousands of registration errors and the registration of ineligible voters.

1104035716282097664.text: Don’t be fooled—H.R. 1 is legislation that has been designed to fund, elect, and maintain the Democratic majority, all while ignoring states’ rights and wasting taxpayer dollars.

1098727599373803520.text: Tune in to @mysuncoast tomorrow night at 7:00 PM to catch my interview with @BillLoganABC7. Hope you will take the time to watch! https://t.co/wJkbzK45v8

1098392960847224832.text: Today, I was honored to host a Water Quality Round Table in my Punta Gorda Office. I’m committed to working with state, local, and federal officials to address water quality issues facing my district and my state. Learn more on my website: https://t.co/xktmfYkU9Z https://t.co/TpFli5v01n

1098367582502117376.text: Today, I visited the @HomeDepot in Venice, FL. I toured the store, discussed their “Doing More for Veterans Program,” and even got my own apron! Looking forward to doing everything I can in DC to support jobs & private enterprise in Florida’s 17th District! Thanks for having me! https://t.co/62f7wyba5H

1098360112010407939.text: This morning, I visited with the Punta Gorda City Commissioners to give them a legislative update on what I’ve been working on in DC. It is great to be in Florida hearing about the important issues facing my constituents! https://t.co/bkgVE8mxhE

1097513307081240576.text: Happy Presidents Day to @realDonaldTrump! Thank you for your service to our great nation! #PresidentsDay

1097511407661314048.text: Happy Presidents Day! Today we honor some of America’s greatest leaders throughout history. Join me in thanking them for their dedicated service and praying for our current and future leaders. #PresidentsDay

1096482231739142145.text: My statement on the House vote on the spending bill: https://t.co/bxs8AXBEz4

1095882692724441089.text: House Judiciary Dems aren’t interested in stopping gun violence, they’re interested in pushing a political agenda that ignores the rights of millions of law-abiding gun owners. This was clear when they rejected my Amendment this afternoon. Learn more here: https://t.co/OAoLlXjou4

1095839787179786241.text: Today I filed an amendment that requires anyone who fails a background check to be reported to law enforcement. Dems voted against it. This gun control bill isn’t about public safety. It’s about taking away the rights of law-abiding citizens.

1093017702527062018.text: Tonight @realDonaldTrump gave an inspiring speech with common sense solutions to big problems facing our country. #BuildThatWall #SOTU

1091131125437734918.text: Our veterans have been neglected for far too long. I look forward to serving on the Veterans' Affairs committe and introducing policies that will have a meaningful impact on our nation's heroes. https://t.co/EWRAib8pym

1091118659395821568.text: Congress was in session for only three days this week, and Nancy Pelosi and House Democrats have yet to offer a serious proposal that secures our borders. Madam Speaker, we're waiting! https://t.co/h5Ba2dXex8

1089979265548992512.text: Washington is a mess, but I am working day in and day out to #SecureOurBorders once and for all! Thank you @mysuncoast for having me on! https://t.co/YDEADYmrvR

1088207639190913024.text: My thoughts and prayers are with the victims of today’s tragic shooting in Sebring. We will stand by law enforcement as they continue their investigation. Thank you Sheriff Blackman and the brave men and women of @HighCoSheriff’s Office. To the people of Sebring, we are with you.

1086365172921499654.text: To the thousands of pro-lifers gathering today, welcome to Washington! #ProLife https://t.co/DPHN7hZa7E
